    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()

      • checkDatabaseVersion

        protected boolean checkDatabaseVersion()
        Returns true if the database version is current, false otherwise. If this method returns false, the database will be rebuilt with a call to dropTables() followed by buildTables(). Subclasses may override this method to support their own versioning mechanism.

        The default implementation compares the version of the database via this.database.DatabaseIface.getVersion() against CATALOG_VERSION.

        Returns:
        true if the database version is current, false otherwise.

      • setDatabaseVersion

        protected void setDatabaseVersion()
        Sets the database versioning to the current version. Subclasses may override this method to support their own versioning mechanism.

        The default implementation sets the version of the database via this.database. DatabaseIface.setVersion(int) with CATALOG_VERSION.

      • dropTables

        protected void dropTables()
        Drops the tables present in the database. This method is invoked in the constructor when the database version is not current.

      • buildTables

        protected void buildTables()
        Builds the tables for the database. This method is invoked in the constructor when the database lacks the catalog table or when if the database version is not current.

        The default implementation invokes createCatalogTable() and returns.

      • createCatalogTable

        protected final void createCatalogTable()
        Creates the catalog table.

      • query

        public CursorIface query​(java.lang.String table,
                         java.lang.String[] columns,
                         java.lang.String selection,
                         java.lang.String[] selectionArgs,
                         java.lang.String groupBy,
                         java.lang.String having,
                         java.lang.String orderBy,
                         java.lang.String limit)
        Performs an arbitrary query on the underlying database.

        It is recommended that the baked query functions be used in most circumstances as the underlying schemas are subject to change.

        Parameters:
        table - The table
        columns - The columns to return
        selection - The where clause
        selectionArgs - The where arguments
        groupBy - The group by clause
        having - The having clause
        orderBy - The order by clause
        limit - The limit clause
        Returns:
        The result
